captions.text:
- Addiction is when
your brain can no longer

resist a craving,
despite the consequences.

Do you know what your little
addictions are costing you?

If the average college
student gave up alcohol
for a year, he'd save $900.

That's twice as much as
you spend on textbooks,

and textbooks are
expensive, so that's a lot.

Let's assume they spend
all this money on beer.
At an average of $1.80 per can,

they would not consume 500
cans of beer in that year,
that's almost 77,000 calories,

which for a 150 pound person
is like running 26 marathons.

Say you're a smoker and you
give up smoking for one year.

The average smoker smokes
half a pack every day,
so quitting for a year would keep
3,650 cigarettes out of your system.

Stacked end to end, that's as
tall as an 80 story building,

plus you'd get to save over
a thousand dollars per year,
which is like getting a brand-new laptop,

and regaining 10 percent
of your lung capacity.

If the average American turned
off the tube for a year,
they wouldn't watch 2.8 hours a day,
so you'd save a thousand hours per year;
with that time you could get a working

proficiency in a new
language of your choice.
- (speaking French)
- Think of how cultured you could become.

If me, the average soda drinker,
gave up soda for a year,

I wouldn't drink almost 60
gallons of soda per year,
that's an indoor jacuzzi full of pop.

So giving up soda for a year
would save me 90,000 calories,

that's almost 25 pounds,
by doing almost nothing.
So what's your addiction costing you?

title: What Are Your Addictions Costing You?

comments.author: Pancake Kitten

comments.text:
Well, I'm not allowed to legally smoke/drink/do any drugs (and I wouldn't 
even DREAM of doing it in the first place! Why would I throw my life out of 
the window for nothing?), I hate soda (carbonated drinks are just not for 
me) and I still attend school, I don't have to really worry about any 
addictions. Sure, some people think I'm addicted to the internet, but 
really, I'm not wasting time... I'm just spending time. I get all my 
homework done, I get straight As in every subject, the teachers like me, 
school work is relatively easy, and I have a handful of close friends. 
Nothing to worry about for me! Anybody else like me?﻿

stuff surrounding us. In the end it's just STUFF!﻿
